metadata.title: CVE-2016-8637 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A local information disclosure issue was found in dracut before 045 whengenerating initramfs images with world-readable permissions when 'earlycpio' is used, such as when including microcode updates. Local attacker canuse this to obtain sensitive information from these files, such asencryption keys or credentials.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dracut - 044+189-1
dracut-config-generic - 044+189-1
dracut-config-rescue - 044+189-1
dracut-core - 044+189-1
dracut-network - 044+189-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dracut package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '044+189-1').
